title: Taurus and Scorpio Compatibility: Love, Sex, and More

steps.title: This is a comfortable match that can be supportive and passionate.
steps.content: This is a comfortable match that can be supportive and passionate. While you're both fixed signs, which means you can be stubborn, you both are looking for stability in a relationship. If you can work through the occasional communication challenges that pop up, you two can enjoy a healthy, long-lasting relationship. [1] X Research source The fact that you're both homebodies definitely brings you together! Embrace your love of home life, but take a break and go out if your Scorpio or Taurus partner starts to get on your nerves.

steps.title: The Scorpio-Taurus couple struggles with compromise and trust.
steps.content: The Scorpio-Taurus couple struggles with compromise and trust. When issues pop up, this couple can't easily share how they're feeling and listen objectively to the other person to come to a solution. For one thing, Taurus is incredibly stubborn. [2] X Expert Source Stina Garbis Psychic Astrologer Expert Interview. 10 December 2021. This can make it hard for them to see Scorpio's point of view. Plus, it's hard for Scorpio to trust others and they tend to be paranoid, assuming the worst. [3] X Expert Source Angel Eyedealism Astrologer & Performance Artist Expert Interview. 8 December 2021. To make the relationship work, both signs must work at sharing concerns without accusing the other person. For instance, saying things like, "I get stressed out when you don't help around the house," rather than, "You never clean up after yourself." Reader Poll: We asked 654 wikiHow readers if they think Taureans are generally controlling and stubborn, and 70% of them said yes . [Take Poll]

steps.title: Both Scorpio and Taurus want a secure, stable relationship.
steps.content: Both Scorpio and Taurus want a secure, stable relationship. Scorpios are into steady, long-term relationships while Taurus is a reliable steadfast sign. It's an astrological combination that totally works! To create a great relationship, they both prioritize the relationship, are completely honest with each other, and support one another when life gets tough. [4] X Research source Since these two put such a high priority on stability in their relationship, both can be possessive or even a little jealous. There won't be problems as long as both partners are faithful. Scorpios are also very shrewd and cautious, so they might take time to commit to a relationship. [5] X Expert Source Angel Eyedealism Astrologer & Performance Artist Expert Interview. 23 December 2021.

steps.title: These two may have a hard time relating to one another.
steps.content: These two may have a hard time relating to one another. Water signs like Scorpio are well known for being emotional and intuitive. Taurus, as an earth sign is just the opposite—grounded, practical, and ruled by logic. Since they approach feelings so differently, they may have a hard time addressing each other’s needs. [6] X Research source Scorpios can overthink their feelings, so it’s not uncommon for them to experience depression. However, a sensible Taurus partner could pull Scorpio away from dwelling too much on their inner thoughts. If both people bring up relationship concerns, offer praise, and share affection on a regular basis, these differences can actually stabilize the relationship. A Taurus could keep Scorpio balanced while Scorpio could help Taurus connect with their feelings.

steps.title: When Scorpio and Taurus come together, sparks can fly!
steps.content: When Scorpio and Taurus come together, sparks can fly! Taurus is well known for being one of the most sensual, touch-driven signs of the zodiac. This makes them a perfect match for passionate Scorpio, possibly the most sexual of all zodiac signs. [7] X Expert Source Angel Eyedealism Astrologer & Performance Artist Expert Interview. 8 December 2021. Taurus creates support in the relationship that allows Scorpio to be sexually daring and vulnerable. This just strengthens their overall relationship.
